intro: Omphalandria triandra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its native habitat. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. The flowers typically bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
